snippet: The government requested “written guarantees” that rebels would stop fighting before it pulled back its troops.
abstract: Government of Syria's Pres Bashar al-Assad puts new conditions on the cease-fire plan drawn up by United Nations and Arab League joint envoy Kofi Annan, requesting written guarantees that the country's rebels will stop fighting before it pulls back its troops; demands cast new doubts on truce that was scheduled to begin within days.
lead_paragraph: The government requested “written guarantees” that rebels would stop fighting before it pulled back its troops.

headline.seo: Syria Demands Guarantees Before a Troop Pullback
headline.main: Cease-Fire in Doubt as Syria Demands New Conditions
headline.print_headline: Cease-Fire in Doubt as Syria Demands New Conditions
